error.signature: Error from server (Forbidden): pods are forbidden: violates PodSecurity

verdict.summary: Pod Security Admission controller rejects pod because it violates the namespace's security standard (restricted, baseline, or privileged).

dead_ends.action: Set the namespace to privileged security level
dead_ends.why_fails: Removes security controls — defeats the purpose of Pod Security Standards
Cluster-wide security regression — not recommended for production

workarounds.action: Fix the pod spec to comply with the security standard: remove privileged, runAsRoot, hostNetwork, etc.
workarounds.how: Set securityContext.runAsNonRoot: true, securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation: false, drop ALL capabilities

workarounds.action: Use 'warn' or 'audit' mode instead of 'enforce' during migration

leads_to.condition: when pod is modified to comply but application breaks without privileges

preceded_by.condition: when admission webhook is the Pod Security Admission controller

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Pod Security Admission rejects the pod spec for violating security standards, while Forbidden user is an RBAC denial on the API caller
